description: Prairie sedge is an amazing plant species due to its versatility and hardiness. Native to North America, it grows in moist meadows and prairie habitats, as well as around creeks and ponds. Not only does it make a stunning addition to any garden, but it can also be used for erosion control. With its short and clump-forming habit, the plant produces spikes of small, fluffy, golden-brown flowers that bloom in late summer. When the flowers die back, the striking seed heads persist throughout the winter, adding interest to the landscape. Tough enough to survive drought, prairie sedge is a must-have for prairie restoration.
